AirFireModeling 0.1.7
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Load BlueSky NetCDF file and return contents as a bs_grid.

bluesky_load.Rd

Reads in a "_V2" BlueSky output NetCDF file and ingests the data, returning it in a list of class bs_grid.

Data are searched for in the package internal dataDir which can be set with setModelDataDir(). If no data are found in the dataDir, and download = TRUE an attempt is made to download data.

If timesteps are specified, the returned bs_grid object will contain data associated with those timesteps. Data missing in the original model run will be replaced with NA values.

bluesky_load(dailyOutputDir = "standard", model = "PNW-1.33km",
  modelRun = NULL, subDir = "combined", parameter = "pm25",
  xlim = NULL, ylim = NULL, timesteps = NULL, download = TRUE,
  cleanup = TRUE, filePath = NULL,
  baseUrl = "https://haze.airfire.org/bluesky-daily/output",
  quiet = FALSE)

Arguments

dailyOutputDir

BlueSky web directory.
model

Model identifier.
modelRun

Date code as "YYYYMMDDHH" (integer or character).
subDir

Subdirectory path containing netcdf data.
parameter

Parameter name.
xlim

Optional longitude range.
ylim

Optional latitude range.
timesteps

Optional vector of timesteps to be loaded. Defaults to all available timesteps in the file.
download

Logical specifying whether to download and convert data if it is not found locally.
cleanup

Logical specifying whether to remove the original files.
filePath

Absolute path of the local bluesky .nc file (not "_V2.nc") for special occasions.
baseUrl

Base URL for BlueSky output.
quiet

If TRUE, suppress status messages (if any), and the progress bar.

Value

List of class bs_grid with the following elements:

  • lon -- 1D vector of longitudes (X)

  • lat -- 1D vector of latitudes (Y)

  • time -- 1D vector of POSIXct times (T)

  • data -- list of 3D arrays of data values (X-Y-T)

  • model -- character name of model used to generate the data

  • modelRun -- character date + hour when the model was run

  • deltaLon -- longitude axis grid cell spacing

  • deltaLat -- latitude axis grid cell spacing

BlueSky output files are found in directories with the following structure:

.../standard/NAM84-0.08deg/2016050600/carryover/data/...
.../standard/NAM84-0.08deg/2016050600/combined/data/...
.../standard/NAM84-0.08deg/2016050600/forecast/data/...

Details

#' On 2019-10-11, vailable model identifiers include the following:

  • AK-12km

  • CANSAC-1.33km

  • CANSAC-4km

  • DRI1.33km-CMAQ

  • DRI4km-CMAQ

  • GFS-0.15deg-CanadaUSA-p25deg-68N

  • GFS-0.15deg

  • NAM-3km

  • NAM84-0.15deg

  • PNW-1.33km

  • PNW-4km

  • PNW1.33km-CMAQ

  • PNW4km-CMAQ

See also

bluesky_download

bluesky_toV2

setModelDataDir

Examples

if (FALSE) {
setModelDataDir('~/Data/Bluesky')

xlim <- c(-118, -114)
ylim <- c(45, 48)
bs_grid <- bluesky_load(
  model = "PNW-1.33km",
  modelRun = 2019100900,
  xlim = xlim,
  ylim = ylim
)
grid_map(bs_grid, tMask = 1:24)
}
